title: Dievole 2015 Le Due Arbie  (Chianti Superiore)
description: Made from 80% Sangiovese and 20% Merlot, this informal red opens with subtle baking spice and cassis aromas. The simple palate evokes black currant jam and vanilla, with round tannins.

title: Domaine de la Croix 2017 Iirrésistible! Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: A blend of seven grapes, this wine demands to be drunk now. With attractive red-berry fruits that are clean and crisply textured, the wine is both refreshing and juicy.

title: Domaine Houchart 2015 Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: This spicy, stalky wine shows tight tannins and acidity, with a black currant flavor. Although richer berry fruits should come forward as the wine develops, expect it to remain on the lean side.

title: Domaine Poli 2017 Sciaccarellu Rosé (Ile de Beauté)
description: This wine's light texture contrasts with its red cherry-like fruitiness. Its acidity and tangy edge are refreshing, as are its touch of minerality and bright aftertaste.

title: Fortant 2017 de Provence Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Crisp with bright red berries, this is a clean, fruity wine. Its acidity and touch of spice from the Grenache in the blend add an attractive bite to contrast with the fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Gehricke 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a steely, pretty wine that becomes creamy and lush on the palate, with tropical flavors and toasted oak. Its medium-bodied style is food friendly and approachable, with an expansiveness that pleases.

title: Godelia 2016 Pilgram Godello (Bierzo)
description: Stalky aromas lack freshness and lean towards briny. A tight citrusy palate is more positive, while this offers slightly stale flavors of dried apricot and mango in front of a chalky finish.

title: I Mori 2015  Chianti Colli Fiorentini
description: This has subdued aromas evoking scorched earth and black-skinned fruit. The simple palate suggests dried berry, tangerine peel and clove, with pliant tannins. Drink soon.

title: Kim Crawford 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: While this delivers in many regards, the style seems more muted and angular than in vintages past. After vigorous swirling in glass it finally displays guava, grapefruit, lime and snow pea characters. It's a crisp style with mouthpuckering acidity and a no-frills disposition.

title: Kokomo 2017 Timber Crest Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Stone-fruit flavors and jasmine aromatics define the core of this light-bodied wine, which is stony in mineral texture with an intense lemony aspect that meets crisp green apple.

title: Komaru 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Ripe citrus and melon along with a touch of lychee and tomato leaf aromas are a bit dull but can be coaxed from the glass. The palate offers a grapefruit and citrus tang with balanced acidity. Simple yet enjoyable. Drink now.

title: La Mormoraia 2016 Suavis  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)
description: This wine's aromas suggest medicinal herbs and acacia. They carry over to the simple palate, along with bitter almond and yellow apple skin notes.

title: Lancaster 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Mocha, chocolate and coconut provide a rich lush entry into this full-bodied, undeniably ripe wine. An herbal underbelly contrasts with the full creamy flavors as tannins elbow in on the lasting finish.

title: Laurentia 2016 Rosé (Grand River Valley)
description: Watermelon hard candy and strawberry popsicle aromas seem sweet on the nose, yet the dry palate offers fresh strawberry and watermelon with a squeeze of lemon juice. This is simple but enjoyable.

title: Lone Birch 2016 Riesling (Yakima Valley)
description: Orange blossom and ripe peach aromas are followed by straightforward off-dry flavors of stone fruit and orange. It delivers easy-drinking enjoyment.

title: Marchese di Pani 2016  Chianti
description: This casual red has wild berry, tangerine peel and culinary spice scents. The easygoing, simple palate shows blueberry jam and star anise notes alongside pliant tannins. Drink soon.

title: Maryhill 2014 Kiona Vineyards Merlot (Red Mountain)
description: Not entirely appealing aromas of green wood, macerated cranberry and cherry lead to wood-dominated fruit flavors (60% new French). The oak takes over the show, completely overwhelming the variety.

title: Merry Cellars 2015 Stillwater Creek Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are high toned, with notes of spice, smoke, black licorice and dark fruit. The black-fruit flavors are more restrained in style than the listed alcohol might suggest, showing a soft texture, with bitters on the finish.

title: Monte Schiavo 2016 Ruviano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: This opens with delicate acacia flower and citrus aromas. The simple, linear palate offers salty white peach and Bartlett pear flavors set against crisp acidity.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Palacio De Canedo 2016 Made With Organic Grapes Godello (Bierzo)
description: Apple, peach and butterscotch aromas are not distinct. A palate comprised mostly of acid has a skins-like texture, while this tastes slightly pickled, with citrus and pineapple notes. On the finish, this Godello is briny and cidery, with a touch of bitterness.

title: Piersanti 2017  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
description: Fresh and fruity, this fun, simple white has tropical fruit, peach and citrus flavors. Bright acidity gives it a tangy finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Príncipe de Viana 2017 Edición Rosa Rosé (Navarra)
description: Punchy aromas of citrus, spice and tomato paste are fresh, leading to a tight palate with bold acidity. Despite that, there's a lightly oxidized component to salty flavors of tomato sauce and apple skins.

title: Protos 2016 P Verdejo (Rueda)
description: A mix of yeasty lemon- and orange-peel aromas are just inviting enough. This Verdejo has a plump but basic mouthfeel along with slightly bitter flavors of citrus skins and salt. A briny green-leaning finish suggests a wine that's beginning to fade.

title: Schug 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a tenacious hold of herbaceous character—bay leaf predominantly—that emphasizes its light-bodied leanness and cool-climate beginnings. The oak is quiet and in the background.

title: Spellbound 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Lots of fruit flavor and a smooth but firm texture make this medium-bodied wine easy to appreciate. There is little oak influence so the fresh and focused cherry and berry flavors take the lead.

title: Staete Landt 2017 Annabel Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Aromas of passionfruit, lime, grapefruit and peach notes are backed by tomato leaves and stones. The palate is taut and focused, with zingy, lime acidity and a green leafy finish.

title: Stone Tower 2013 Petit Verdot (Virginia)
description: Notes of blackberry, plum, cedar and fig are found on the nose and palate, with additional tones of resin and charred wood. While the acidity is fresh, the tannins are intensely parching. The finish is long and overtly woody.

title: Taft Street 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Stainless-steel fermented, this white is fruity and fresh, with a nutty character that rides alongside ripe apricot and melon. There's a robust intensity to the finish.

title: UVAL 2017 Terra Nostra Blanc Vermentino (Corse)
description: This featherlight, perfumed wine is soft, fruity and very ready to drink. Its acidity and lightly mineral texture are immediately attractive, filled out with fine, final fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2017 Flair  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Recognizable for its bulldog mascot in sunglasses on the label, this is a rich, intensely fruity Sauvignon Blanc. Great acidity is balanced with rich apple and ripe Bartlett pear flavors that lead to a refreshing tang at the end. Drink the wine now.
